Getting started with fsp

fsp.Rmd

What this package is supposed to be

The idea is to collate a set of functions to assist with updating sections of the pocketbook, together with examples of using them in the articles on this site to make guidance for producing items in the publication.

Installation

You can install the development version of fsp from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("FoodchainStats/fsp")

Usage

There are several broad categories of functions, generally aimed at helping to access datasets that underlie pocketbook content, and wrangle it into useful shape.

url_* functions simply store the address of where the datasets are. They are used by other fsp functions to download data. If things arent working the first thing you can do is manually check these url to see that they are pointing to the right data.

acquire_* functions actually download data. By default they download into a temporary file, but you can specify a folder to download to. These functions return the path to the downloaded file. You can use the output of acquire_* functions with, eg read.csv() or other similar functions. Alternatively…

get_* functions wrap around url and acquire, reading in data and returning a tibble. In most cases they also do a bit of light processing, eg cleaning up variable names. For some source datasets they may return an element of the underlying data, such as only the monthly or yearly data, or metadata about the dataset contents.
